🚀 The advertising sector in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region is undergoing a significant transformation. The rise of digitalization has brought about notable changes in programmatic advertising, particularly through the heightened reliance on data and technology, as well as the growing significance of mobile programmatic ads in fueling market expansion. It is anticipated that advertising spending will exceed 12 billion U.S. dollars by 2024, showing a substantial increase from the approximately 9.2 billion in 2021. This indicates substantial growth potential in the MENA region’s advertising domain. The Middle East and Africa’s #programmatic #advertising market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 7.89% from 2022 to 2027, driven by the adoption of programmatic guaranteed and contextual #targeting practices. The MENA advertising market is thriving, with the market value standing at $8.11 billion in 2023 and expected to reach $17.36 billion by 2029. Key growth drivers include rising smartphone use and widespread mobile adoption. Mobile ads dominate MENA's digital market, providing advertisers a prime opportunity to reach their audience through apps and mobile platforms. Additionally, the growing internet connectivity in the MENA region is exposing more individuals to online marketing, including popular social media platforms. The shift to programmatic advertising, which leverages data and technology to serve personalized ads, is also contributing to this market's expansion. Key Insights from IAB MENA’s 2023 Digital Ad Spend Study: *** A $6.25 Billion Industry *** 👇👇 The digital advertising landscape in MENA continues to evolve and grow, as highlighted by the recent IAB MENA study. Here’s a breakdown of the key findings: Growth Overview: • MENA Digital Ad Spend Growth: 13.6% • Europe: 11.1% • US: 7.3% Digital Ad Spend Distribution: • Social Media: 54% • Display (excluding social): 28.8% (with a 15% increase in video, 4% growth in display) • Search: 14.1% • Other: 2.2% Trends and Shifts: • Social Media Dominance: Social media remains the dominant platform for digital ad spend, particularly with significant growth in social video (31.5% increase). However, social banners have seen a decline (-2.4%). • Non-Social Video and Search: These areas recorded the highest growth rates, highlighting a shift in brand budgets and storytelling towards digital platforms, especially social commerce. Country-Specific Insights: • Saudi Arabia (KSA): Leading with 44% of the market spend, totaling $2.7 billion. • UAE: $2 billion in ad spend. • Growth Rates: UAE (14.3%), Other GCC (9%), Egypt (8.6%). Growth Drivers: • Connected TV (CTV) • Gaming • Digital Out-of-Home (OOH) • Retail Media: Leveraging data to target ads, which saw a 30% growth in 2023. • Performance Optimization: Enhancing supply chain efficiency and ROI in digital spending. KSA stands out as a top player in the EMEA market, ranking among the top 10.

As we look to the future, it's clear that RTB will continue to play a vital role in shaping the industry. By 2025, the RTB market is projected to reach a staggering $35.4 billion, up from $12.4 billion in 2022. So, what does the future hold for RTB? For starters, we can expect to see increased adoption of advanced technologies like AI and machine learning. These technologies will enable more precise targeting, improved efficiency, and greater transparency. In fact, a recent study found that AI-powered RTB campaigns see an average increase of 25% in ROI. Case in point: When a leading automotive brand partnered with a prominent SSP, they leveraged AI-powered RTB to target high-intent audiences. The result? A 30% increase in conversions and a 20% decrease in CPA. Another key trend shaping the future of RTB is the rise of first-party data. As third-party cookies become a thing of the past, advertisers will turn to first-party data to fuel their RTB campaigns. This shift will lead to more accurate targeting, improved customer experiences, and increased brand loyalty. The future of RTB is bright. With advancements in technology, increased adoption of first-party data, and growing demand for transparency and efficiency, RTB will continue to drive innovation and growth in the digital advertising landscape.
